results.title: Miracle in Milan = miracolo a Milano
results.creator_credit: Vittorio De Sica, Nino Misiano, l'E N I C and De Sica Productions
results.brief_description: Based on the book ‘Toto il Buono’, acclaimed director Vittorio De Sica has produced a captivating fable, co-written by long-time collaborator Cesare Zavattini, mixing his sometimes harsh reality with fantastic characters and events in an increasingly unreal setting. The main character Toto, himself a rescued foundling, is a philanthropist, determined to help his fellow man in the way he was helped by the woman who adopted him. Mingling De Sica’s trademark neo-realism, in this case the shameful treatment of displaced persons after the War, with whimsical fantasy, this film won Best Film award at the 1951 Cannes Film Festival. Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Good morning Babylon
results.creator_credit: Vittorio Taviani, Paolo Taviani, Giuliani De Negri, Films A2, RA11, Pressman Film Corporation, MK2 Productions and Filmtre
results.brief_description: The Taviani Brothers’ first English language film is a bitter-sweet and joyous celebration of the early days of Hollywood movie making. Based on a true story, the film is a piece of pure and thrilling cinema and features an acclaimed performance by Charles Dance as the legendary director D.W. Griffith. Two Tuscan stonemason brothers decide to leave Italy for the New World when their father’s firm becomes bankrupt. They travel to Hollywood and wangle their way onto the film set of Griffith. They fall in love and celebrate a double wedding, however war soon intervenes to threaten their happiness.

results.title: Blowup
results.creator_credit: Michelangelo Antonioni, Carlo Ponti, Premier Productions and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: Inspired by a short story by Julio Cortazar, Antonioni uses the narrative structure of the detective story and employs spatial depth and appearance to question the viewer’s sense of what is real and what is not. Set against a backdrop of London, the film follows young fashion photographer Thomas (David Hemmings) as he snaps his way through the world of 1960s British counterculture. While wandering through a park one day, he photographs two lovers, only to discover while printing and enlarging the images in his darkroom, that he may have inadvertently photographed a murder. Cast includes Vanessa Redgrave, Sarah Miles, John Castle and Jane Birkin. Music by Herbert Hancock. Cinematography by Carlo di Palma.

results.title: Death of a Neapolitan mathematician
results.creator_credit: Mario Martone, Angelo Curti and Teatri Uniti
results.brief_description: Naples in 1959, a society entrenched in cynicism, is the setting for the final sceneds in the life of Renato Caccioppoli - a brilliant intellectual, admired academic and political non-conformist. His rejection of Italian society that lacks social and political will is implicit in his actions, whilst his tolerance towards everything and everyone that surrounds him is diminishing fast. The film follows the mathematician’s last week, from his arrest as a vagrant in a railway station, to his release and his bitter farewell to his friends and beloved. Italian language with English subtitles.

results.title: Brilliant lies
results.brief_description: Not since ‘Disclosure’ have sexual games been so dirty. Based on David Williamson’s play of the same name it is the story of Susie O’Connor (Gia Carides), who says that from the moment she started working for him, her boss sexually harassed her. When she didn’t submit to his advances, she was sacked. She sues her boss (Anthony LaPaglia) for compensation - but he claims he never touched her and she made it all up. The challenge when watching this highly stylised movie is to determine who is telling the truth and who is telling brilliant lies.

results.title: Hotel de Love
results.creator_credit: Craig Rosenburg, David Parker, Michael Lake and Pratt Film Productions
results.brief_description: Teenagers, smooth-talking party animal, Rick (Aden Young) and his shy twin brother Stephen (Simon Bossell) fall for the same gorgeous uni student, Melissa (Saffron Burrows). Rick woos her and then loses her. A decade on and Rick is working as the manager of Hotel de Love, a tacky, neon-laced romantic hideaway, whilst Stephen has buried himself in the world of stockbroking. Life is dull and unchallenging until Melissa arrives at the hotel and the hijinks begin. Also starring Pippa Grandison, Ray Barrett and Julia Blake.

results.title: Sense and sensibility (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Ang Lee, Lindsay Doran, Columbia Pictures and Mirage Enterprises
results.brief_description: Ang Lee directs this well scripted, acted and beautifully photographed version of Jane Austen’s first novel. Emma Thompson, (who wrote the screenplay), and Kate Winslet are Elinor and Marianne. Elinor follows her head and Marianne is guided by her heart. Both sisters eventually find love but only after the usual complications. A star-studded cast includes Hugh Grant and Alan Rickman

results.title: Children of the revolution
results.creator_credit: Peter Duncan, Tristram Miall and Film Finance Corporation Australia
results.brief_description: ‘Children of the Revolution’ is a delightful comedy which takes an irreverent look at political idealism. When Joan Fraser (Judy Davis), a zealous communist, visits Stalin in Moscow it’s the height of the Menzies era. She returns to Australia pregnant. Could her Stalinist love child change the course of Australian history? Wonderful performances from Judy Davis and Sam Neill (in an ironic twist on their roles in ‘My Brilliant Career’!) as well as Geoffrey Rush, Richard Roxburgh, Rachel Griffiths and F. Murray Abraham as Stalin.

results.title: Hatari
results.creator_credit: Howard Hawks, Malabar Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Director Howard Hawks reteams with John Wayne, who heads a group of highly skilled professional game hunters in Africa. They don’t use bullets, rather capturing the ferocious big game with rope and cameras for zoos and circus attractions, an exciting business that pits man against beast. “Hatari” means “danger” in Swahili and the fine cast of this spectacular adventure film also includes Hardy Kruger, Red Buttons and Elsa Martinelli and Gerard Blain.

results.title: White heat
results.creator_credit: Raoul Walsh, Louis F. Edelman and Warner Bros Pictures
results.brief_description: The searing classic featuring the last great gangster performance by the legendary James Cagney. In 1931, Cagney stunned audiences with his portrayal of a no-good street punk in “Public Enemy” and helped define the screens’ image of underworld thugs. In “White Heat” he expands that image with a blistering performance as psychotic gangland kingpin Cody Jarrett. Devoted to his hard boiled Ma and possessed of an itchy trigger finger, Jarrett is a study of unequalled ferocity, a walking timebomb who robs, tortures and kills without conscience. When he is finally captured, Jarrett escapes a murder rap by doing time for a lesser crime. Still, “The Big House” cannot hold him and he escapes into one of the most famous finales of movie history. Driven by Raoul Walsh’s keen direction and Cagney’s vivid, hypnotic characterisation, “White Heat” won Life Magazine’s kudos as a wild and exciting picture of mayhem and madness.
